channel.title: NPR Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Martínez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: President Trump's special envoy Steve Witkoff visits Russia for talks over Ukraine war, the MAGA world was on the side of Israel — now it is split over Gaza, how Pam Bondi has redefined the Attorney General role.

item.title: Trump's special envoy Steve Witkoff visits Russia for talks over Ukraine war
item.description: President Trump's special envoy Steve Witkoff arrived in Moscow. This, ahead of Trump's Friday deadline for the Kremlin to pause the fighting in Ukraine, or face severe economic penalties.

item.title: Former diplomat Kurt Volker on Ukraine talks between the U.S. and Russia
item.description: Special Envoy Steve Witkoff is in Moscow to talk to Russian President Vladimir Putin about ending the war in Ukraine. Former Special Representative to Ukraine Kurt Volker weighs in on how the negotiations might go.

item.title: Texas flood relief waits as redistricting fights block the legislature
item.description: Tens of millions of dollars have been donated for Texas flood relief. But families wait for help, as the Texas GOP decided to prioritize redistricting and Democrats decamped to block votes.

item.title: Lin-Manuel Miranda on the 10th anniversary of the musical 'Hamilton' on Broadway
item.description: For the 10th anniversary of the debut of "Hamilton: An American Musical" on Broadway, NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with Lin-Manuel Miranda about the origin and legacy of the show.

item.title: The MAGA world was on the side of Israel, now it is split over Gaza
item.description: Until recently, the MAGA world was solidly on the side of Israel in its conflict with Hamas. But the news of starvation in Gaza has created a rift.

item.title: Trump's immigration policies are having an impact in our workforce
item.description: Under President Trump's immigration policies, thousands of workers have lost legal status and authorization to work. Those who remain on the job are feeling their absence.

item.title: Study finds female mountain gorillas prefer to join 'buddies'
item.description: When female gorillas leave one social group and join another, they tend to seek out groups with other females that they've lived with in the past, showing the power of long-term relationships.

item.title: A new law firm challenges Trump's executive powers
item.description: A new law firm formed this week with a mission to challenge President Trump's executive power. NPR's Leila Fadel speaks with James Pearce, one of the firm's top lawyers, about the legal void it intends to fill.

item.title: A zoo in Denmark is asking people to donate their small pets as food
item.description: A zoo in Denmark is making waves by allowing people to donate their aging pets and livestock as food for zoo animals.
